body_html:
@zheng-xq Thank you for the work-around. If this can be implemented in tensorflow tf.multinomial it would be much, much appreciated.

The main problem as I said above is that you have to run .eval() to input your tensor into a numpy function. Much of our code is not designed to be evaluated at that point. So having a solution that specifically handles tensorflow's tensor would be amazing! Thank you for the help regardless.
body_text:
@zheng-xq Thank you for the work-around. If this can be implemented in tensorflow tf.multinomial it would be much, much appreciated.
The main problem as I said above is that you have to run .eval() to input your tensor into a numpy function. Much of our code is not designed to be evaluated at that point. So having a solution that specifically handles tensorflow's tensor would be amazing! Thank you for the help regardless.
body:
@zheng-xq Thank you for the work-around. If this can be implemented in tensorflow `tf.multinomial` it would be much, much appreciated.

The main problem as I said above is that you have to run `.eval()` to input your tensor into a numpy function. Much of our code is not designed to be evaluated at that point. So having a solution that specifically handles tensorflow's `tensor` would be amazing! Thank you for the help regardless.
